solution.text:
Amount of water in the tank at _{k}_ am is _{{j*0.5}}_ litres
duration of outflow to be considered is \(_{{k+3}}_\,am-_{k}_\,am\,=3 hours\)
rate of discharge of water = \(_{l}_\,litres\,per\,hour\)
As the decrement in the amount of water is constant(d)= -\(_{l}_\)
so, the water in the tank after each hour will form an AP
The first term as \(a_1=_{{0.5*j}}_\,and\,d=-_{l}_\)
Now the water in the tank after 3 hours(n=4) is= \(a_1-3d\)
\(_{{0.5*j}}_-_{{(3*l)}}_=_{{(0.5*j)-(3*l)}}_\)

content.text:
A tank with a capacity of _{j}_ litres is half filled with water.
At _{k}_ am someone turns the outlet valve on
The water starts to spill out from the tank at a rate of _{l}_ litres per hour.
How much water is left in the tank at _{{k+3}}_ am.
